APRIL TERM, 1790.

The State against Carr, and others. THIS was an indictment for larceny, and dn the trial, no evidence appearing against one of the prisoners, the Counsel for the others moved that he might be sworn as a witness in their behalf. Rote. — In an information for a misdemeanor, the Attorney General offered to examine one of the defendants as a witness for the king, which the court would not permit until a -noli prosequi was entered. Bull. «V. P. 285. And where one was through mistake made a party, the court gave permission, after issue joined, to strike his name from die record and admitted him as a witness. Siderfin. 441. So where one was made a defendant for the express purpose of excluding his testimony, if nothing be proved against him he maybe admitted as a witness. Bull. JV. P. 285. But the fact must clearly appear that there is no evidence to inculpate him. Addison 352. Pennsylvania -v. Leach. And where a verdict has passed against a defendant, or for him, or he has suffered judgment to go by default, Bull. 285. or on submission has been fined: {Rex v. Fletcher. 1 Str. 633 ) he is a competent witness. In such case the confessions of the party who makes default may be given in evidence to show the amount of damages,. Bostwick v. Lewis l Bay’s Cases, 33. See Peake’s Mvid. 160. Gill), £vid. 134. Slockham v. Jones et al. 10 Johns. 21. The People v. Rill 10 Johns. 95. % Caines 79. nota, 2 Campbell N. P. 833. nets. One of several indicted, not admitted a witness though no evidence adduced to criminate him. Attorney General Contra,

The Court overruled the motion and rejected the witness.
